data.title: Allow to manually edit path for exported NodePath
data.body: Currently there is no way to manually change path for exported NodePath. It would be great if there would be ability to normally modify the path from the keyboard. It would be especially helpful in cases when we want to write absolute path or when the node we want to target is on another scene (and we are targeting from subscene).

data.title: Fix animation toolbar
data.body: Closes #3465.

data.title: Add travis-ci badge to show the status of master
data.body: This PR should also allow us to actually test the feature by triggering a first build :P

data.title: LineEdit: "focus_exit" signal misbehaviour
data.body:
LineEdit is emitting signal "focus_exit" when enter-key is pressed.
As the focus stays on the LineEdit on hitting enter (is it on purpose?),
this signal should not be fired.

data.title: AutoLoad, Node position moves up on singleton enable/disable
data.body: Add  a few Autoload Nodes enable Singleton on one of the bottom Nodes press close, reopen Autoload see that it moved up.

data.title: AutoLoad not able to change NodeName
data.body:
I don't want to re add the Node to update the name.
Suggestion: Add double click on the name to update?

data.title: replacing nodes leaves the name of the previous node
data.body:
![screenshot from 2016-01-27 12-10-32](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6195060/12610372/05e83ef0-c4f0-11e5-988f-085fe71cb909.png)

So i have kinematicbody for example. and I replace it with a rigid body.
it changes correctly and I can see the properties of the rigid body. but the name stays the same.
not sure if a bug. but it certainly confused me.

data.title: The loc, rot, scale, insert key and animation buttons, are absent from the 2.0 beta.
data.body:
Hi.
The loc, rot, scl, insert key and animation buttons, are absent from the 2.0 beta when you are editing an animation, at least for 2D.

data.title: Android Crash (No implementation found for void org.godotengine.godot.GodotLib.initialize)

data.title: Remove strand debug print, fix #3473
Revert "make msvc 64bits build again, fixes #3098"
data.body:
This reverts commit b21ce6cecbd75ae3281177c4890902586ca710f7.

As discussed in #3098, this fix is not needed and might be removing optimizations from the Theora library.

data.title: "has right" sentence printed in the console.
data.body:
Is there a reason for this line of the code?
'''
if (tabs[p_idx].right_button.is_valid()) {
        **_print_line("has right");**_
        Ref<Texture> rb=tabs[p_idx].right_button;
'''
in the file:
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/dfbc2dce177462506d9c41dfaa867dd76bd136a7/scene/gui/tabs.cpp

It prints "has right" all the time in the terminal.

data.title: Children of ScrollContainer are not shown properly
data.body:
Setup: 
[root] Control
---ScrollContainer
------GridContainer
Script is wired up to put an instance of InventorySlot scene inside GridContainer. 

As you can see at http://postimg.org/image/okw36jgt7/ last row of elements is not fully displayed and ScrollContainer doesn't allow to scroll the list to the actual end. 
Setting "MinumumSize" property for elements seems to increase space BETWEEN elements, rather than forcing elements to show up completely. Several kinds of anchor combinations were tried (it seems that this whole issue is closely tied to anchors) but, alas, to no avail.

More info in forum topic: http://godotengine.org/topics/13791?r=13802

data.title: remove dependancy on libevdev
data.body:
Fixes #3439. I couldn't find a clean way to link libevdev statically, so I just removed it.
Anyway, it's basically only a fancy wrapper around `read()` and `ioctl()` calls so we don't _really_ need it.

The diff looks heavier than it is, mostly because of added blocks and the resulting change in intendation :P

I am running Godot 2.0 on Ubuntu 15.10. (Both 64-bit)

data.title: Remember to link linux binaries with static stdc++
data.body:
Then this error will be solved
./Godot_v2.0_beta_20160126_x11.64: /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6: version `GLIBCXX_3.4.20' not found (required by ./Godot_v2.0_beta_20160126_x11.64)

data.title: Focus and select line edit every time color is changed. Fixes #2586
Invalid Audio Driver: PulseAudio error with pre-compiled 2.0 beta
data.body:
Using the 2.0 beta downloaded from the website today (Ubuntu 15.10), if I load an old project that has

```
[audio]
driver="PulseAudio"
```

in the engine.cfg then the project fails to load, Godot exits, and I get a popup window that says:

`Invalid Audio Driver: PulseAudio`

If I remove the `driver` line from engine.cfg then the project loads and audio seems to work fine. If I compile Godot myself then `driver="PulseAudio"` works. Seems like the beta was compiled without PulseAudio support?

data.title: "S" shortcut when in GridMap crashes Godot
data.body: when editing a GridMap and using the "S" shortcut for rotating a tile on Y axis will crash Godot. Rotating the tile on Y axis by using the menu just work fine. "A" and "D" shortcuts works fine too.

data.title: Add gradle files to gitignore
Fix crash when renaming nodes using focus loss
data.body: Closes #3457.

data.title: Crash when focus is lost during changing name of node that's decorating external scene
data.body:
1. We have inherited scene, or we are editing instance of external scene with 'Editable children' 
2. We are adding new scene instance to one of the children possessed by inherited scene.
3. Click on recently added scene, in the way like we would like to change it's name.
4. Click with your mouse on **another node** in scene tree tab to lost 'change name' focus
5. Godot will crash.

Note that we can normally change the name of this node if we will accept it with keyboard 'enter' key

Tested in e4cb104e6daa9c2e5781535ac8790f406ae53f08 commit
Video for quick judge: https://youtu.be/orM0doUT_JU 
Sample project: [CrashOnNameChange.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/105100/CrashOnNameChange.zip)
